newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Wife of S.Africa's oldest apartheid president dies.
newsitem.headline: Wife of S.Africa's oldest apartheid president dies.

text.p: Elize Botha, wife of South Africa's oldest surviving apartheid president P.W. Botha died at their coastal home near George, national radio said on Saturday.
The radio said 75-year-old Mrs Botha died of a heart attack.
Mrs Botha was a keen supporter of her husband's political career which ended in 1989 after he suffered a stroke and was forced to quit the presidency in favour of former president F.W. de Klerk.
His resignation cleared the way for accelerated reform and an end to apartheid under de Klerk, who freed Nelson Mandela and unbanned the now ruling African National Congress in February 1990.

Botha has refused to testify before South Africa's Truth and Reconciliation Commission on apartheid-era crimes. The commission was set up by President Mandela to promote national reconciliation and heal the wounds of the past.
